sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Using skip as an output item in a put statement causes the current output line to be ended and a new line to be started.
sections.mdown_content: Using **skip** as an output item in a **put** statement causes the current output line to be ended and a new line to be started.

sections.title: Example
code: put "To be", skip, "Or not to be"
sections.raw_content: This example, To be is output on one line and Or not to be on the next.
sections.mdown_content: This example, *To be* is output on one line and *Or not to be* on the next.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Using skip is equivalent to outputting the newline character "\n".
sections.mdown_content: Using **skip** is equivalent to outputting the newline character "\n".
